# Checklist: Disclosure and Evidence

<!-- 
  Purpose: Ensure complete and compliant disclosure and evidence gathering.
  Usage: Use from pre-action stage through to trial preparation.
  Importance: Proper disclosure and evidence management is critical to case success and compliance.
-->

---

## Instructions

- Begin initial evidence gathering at instruction stage
- Complete disclosure section after close of pleadings
- Update regularly as case progresses
- Review before each case management hearing
- Ensure compliance with CPR Part 31 (disclosure) and Part 32 (evidence)
- File completed sections in evidence section of file

---

## Matter Information

**Client Name:** ........................  
**Fee Earner:** ........................  
**Date:** ........................  
**Case Stage:** [ ] Pre-action [ ] Post-issue [ ] CMC [ ] Pre-trial

## PART A: EVIDENCE GATHERING

## 1. DOCUMENTS FROM CLIENT

### Testamentary Documents

- [ ] Copy of current/disputed will

- [ ] Previous wills (all versions)
- [ ] Codicils
- [ ] Draft wills
- [ ] Instructions to solicitor for will

**Location of originals:** ........................

**Obtained/Status:** [ ] Complete [ ] Partial [ ] Awaiting

---

### Estate Documents

- [ ] Grant of probate/letters of administration
- [ ] Death certificate
- [ ] Inheritance tax forms (IHT400/IHT205)
- [ ] Estate accounts
- [ ] Asset valuations
- [ ] Bank statements of estate accounts
- [ ] Property valuations
- [ ] Schedule of assets and liabilities

**Status:** [ ] Complete [ ] Partial [ ] Awaiting

---

**If refused, action taken:** [........................]

**Status:** [ ] Complete [ ] Partial [ ] Awaiting

---

### Correspondence

- [ ] Letters from/to executor/administrator
- [ ] Letters from/to solicitors
- [ ] Letters from/to other beneficiaries
- [ ] Family correspondence
- [ ] Emails and text messages (if relevant)

**Status:** [ ] Complete [ ] Partial [ ] Awaiting

---

### Client's Evidence

- [ ] Client's witness statement obtained
- [ ] Supporting documents from client gathered
- [ ] Timeline/chronology prepared
- [ ] Client's financial position documented (if Inheritance Act claim)

## PART B: DISCLOSURE

## 5. DISCLOSURE OBLIGATIONS

### Disclosure Order

**Standard disclosure ordered:** Date ........................

**Specific disclosure ordered:** [ ] Yes [ ] No
- Details: [........................]

**Deadline for disclosure:** ........................

**Status:** [ ] On track [ ] At risk [ ] Complete

---

### Documents to Disclose

Under CPR 31.6, must disclose documents:
- On which party relies
- Which adversely affect own case
- Which adversely affect another party's case  
- Which support another party's case

---

### Without Prejudice

- [ ] Without prejudice communications exist
- [ ] Properly marked as without prejudice

---

### Privilege Log

- [ ] Privilege log prepared if required
- [ ] Describes nature of privileged documents
- [ ] Explains basis of privilege

---

## 8. DISCLOSURE STATEMENT (CPR 31.10)

### Preparation

- [ ] Disclosure statement drafted
- [ ] Lists all documents being disclosed
- [ ] Sets out extent of search
- [ ] Certifies understanding of duty to disclose
- [ ] Right person to make statement identified (party or person in control)

**To be signed by:** ........................ (Client/Officer of company)

- [ ] Statement explained to signatory
- [ ] Signed and dated

---

### Contents of List

- [ ] Part 1: Documents in party's control willing to disclose
- [ ] Part 2: Documents in party's control objecting to disclose (privileged)
- [ ] Part 3: Documents no longer in party's control

**Documents numbered sequentially:** [ ] Yes

**Documents adequately described:** [ ] Yes

## 12. CONTINUING DISCLOSURE OBLIGATION

### Duty Continues Until Proceedings Conclude

- [ ] Team reminded of continuing duty
- [ ] Process for identifying new documents established
- [ ] Supplemental disclosure list prepared if new documents found

**Supplemental disclosure made:**
- Date: ........................
- Documents: ........................

---

## 13. DOCUMENT MANAGEMENT

### Organization

- [ ] Disclosed documents indexed
- [ ] Electronic disclosure database created (if large volume)
- [ ] Key documents identified and flagged
- [ ] Documents cross-referenced to pleadings and witness statements

---

### Trial Bundle

- [ ] Key documents for trial identified
- [ ] Documents organized chronologically/thematically
- [ ] Bundle pagination planned
- [ ] (See separate hearing preparation checklist)

---

## 14. PRESERVATION OF DOCUMENTS

### Document Retention

- [ ] Client advised not to destroy any relevant documents
- [ ] Electronic data preservation instructions given
- [ ] Third parties notified of preservation obligation (if relevant)

---

### Chain of Custody (If Original Documents Critical)

- [ ] Original documents in secure storage
- [ ] Access log maintained
- [ ] Chain of custody documented

---

## 15. ELECTRONIC DISCLOSURE

### E-Disclosure Issues

- [ ] Volume of electronic documents assessed
- [ ] E-disclosure protocol considered/agreed
- [ ] Search terms agreed
- [ ] Format of disclosure agreed (PDF/native files)
- [ ] Metadata to be preserved: [ ] Yes [ ] No

---

## 16. COMPLIANCE AND QUALITY

### Compliance Check

- [ ] All disclosure obligations met
- [ ] Deadlines complied with
- [ ] Privilege properly claimed
- [ ] Disclosure statement accurate and complete

---

### Quality Review

- [ ] Peer review of disclosure list
- [ ] Supervisor approval of disclosure
- [ ] Privilege claims reviewed by supervisor
- [ ] Any unusual aspects escalated

---
